Enumeration Type Documentation

enum EagleLoggerSeverity

Every logged event has a severity.

This is a value between 0 (the least severe) to 100 (the most severe).

Enumerator:
EagleLoggerSeverityFatal 

A fatal error means that the program can not continue.

This is the most serious level.

EagleLoggerSeverityError 

An error is a problem that has stopped a task from continuing but the state of the program is recoverable and it will continue.

EagleLoggerSeverityUserError 

This is an error because it stopped the execution of a task, but the error is not within eagle.

A bad input has been provided. A good example would be a mistake in the SQL syntax of a query.

EagleLoggerSeverityInfo 

This describes events in the system that have no effect on the flow of execution, such as start up and shutdown messages.

EagleLoggerSeverityDebug 

Debug messages can be very verbose and explain this that are happening that may have nothing to do with the actual execution.
